answers.answer: Generally it's done between 24 - 28 weeks. I wouldn't say it's obligatory but it is highly recommended that you have it done.  It checks for gestational diabetes which is something that NEEDS to be treated if necessary.  I've had it with ALL my pregnancies.  I always do the 1 hr glucose and it comes back high so I repeate with the 3 hour glucose and it's fine.  There's really nothing to it.  Go to this link for more information:http://www.babycenter.com/0_glucose-screening-and-glucose-tolerance-test_1483.bc

Im not really sure if you are obligated to,but I just had mine the other day.Im in my 27th week.My family has a history of diabetes(I myself am borderline diabetic)so naturally they want to make sure everything is ok.Im so glad that the drink wasnt as bad or sugary to me as it was 14 years ago.The new orange flavor definitely went down better than the stuff years ago.I think its worthwhile to make sure there are no probs,and if there are,time to address them so that mom and baby will be ok.
Thanks for your responses and your advice, I`m 19 weeks now but I`ll make that test at 24 weeks.

Good idea that you're having it done.....I have a strong family history of it and they had testing me immediately with blood work.......Under normal circumstances they wait until after 20 weeks b/c it's around that time that the baby's pancreas is formed, which is usually what causes Mom's sugar to be off.

I think I had to eat jelly beans when I took mine with my first pregnancy. It isn't really harmful, but I think you can refuse it if you want. However, gestational diabetes could be very bad for you and baby. So, I would definitely take it.

I was not obligated to take it. It does not run in my family and also every appt. I go to, there are never any signs of sugar in my urine. If my midwife noticed that I did have some sort of sign of it, then I would have it done. she basically gave me the option. I chose not to do it, also my mom said it made her very sick when she did.  It's not something you have to, but most OB docs just recommend it.
